perturbation.original_text: Manufacturer shall manufacture and supply each Product (including disposing of all Waste and other materials) in accordance with all applicable Specifications, applicable Laws, requirements under the applicable Quality Agreement, and this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Manufacturer shall endeavor to manufacture and supply each Product (including disposing of all Waste and other materials) in general accordance with applicable Specifications, applicable Laws, requirements under the applicable Quality Agreement, and this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text creates a strict obligation. By changing 'shall' to 'shall endeavor' and adding 'general accordance,' the obligation becomes ambiguous and less enforceable. Compliance is now based on effort rather than strict adherence.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Violates cGMP (Current Good Manufacturing Practices) regulations which require strict adherence to manufacturing standards and quality controls.

perturbation.original_text: Manufacturer will store Products, Buy-Sell Materials, Product Materials, and Customer-Supplied Materials in accordance with the requirements of the Quality Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Manufacturer will generally store Products, Buy-Sell Materials, Product Materials, and Customer-Supplied Materials in a manner that it believes is consistent with the Quality Agreement requirements.
perturbation.explanation: The modification uses 'generally' and 'believes is consistent' introduces subjectivity, weakening the obligation to strictly adhere to the Quality Agreement's storage requirements. This makes enforcing proper storage conditions difficult.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Violates cGMP and FDA guidelines for proper storage conditions of pharmaceutical materials.

perturbation.original_text: Manufacturer shall maintain detailed Records with respect to Product Materials, Buy-Sell Materials, and Customer-Supplied Materials usage and finished Product production in accordance with the Quality Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Manufacturer will aim to maintain Records with respect to Product Materials, Buy-Sell Materials, and Customer-Supplied Materials usage and finished Product production, as it reasonably interprets the Quality Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall maintain detailed Records' to 'will aim to maintain Records' and adding 'as it reasonably interprets the Quality Agreement,' the obligation to maintain specific, detailed records becomes subjective and less binding. It becomes difficult to verify if the Records maintained are sufficient.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Violates FDA requirements for maintaining accurate and complete manufacturing and quality control records.
